title: Workshop on Phonics Instructional Design for [Large-Scale] Secondary English Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of elementary English grammar and pronunciation systems
context.additional_context: A structured course for pre-service teachers to systematically acquire phonics instruction competencies before field practice, focusing on pedagogy aligned with national curriculum standards.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately interpret 80% or more of the phonics-related requirements in the national English curriculum.
Learners can create lesson plans incorporating seven phonics knowledge dimensions (phonological awareness, decoding rules, etc.).
Learners can conduct a 30-minute simulated lesson applying learner-adapted phonics instructional approaches (e.g., multisensory integration).
Learners can develop five or more phonics-linked activities through textbook analysis.

resources: Phonics Specialty Teaching Kit (Consonant/Vowel Cards, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
